title: Awesome List Updates on Jul 25, 2023
_seo_title: Awesome List Updates on Jul 25, 2023 - Track Awesome List

items.title: Awesome Healthcare
items.content_text:
### Contents / EHR

*   [ERPNext (‚≠ê26k)](https://github.com/frappe/erpnext) - Modules that help manage patients, appointments, consultations, lab tests, and billing.
*   [HOSxP](https://hosxp.net/wordpress/) - Thai Hospital Information System that aims to ease the healthcare workflow of health centers and central hospitals.

### Contents / Specifications

*   [Continuity of Care Document](https://www.hl7.org/implement/standards/product_brief.cfm?product_id=7) - Continuity of Care Document specifications
*   [DICOM Standards Browser](https://dicom.innolitics.com/ciods) - Provides an effective way to learn the DICOM standard and inspect DICOM attributes.
*   [HL7 Version 2](https://www.hl7.org/implement/standards/product_brief.cfm?product_id=185) - Specifications for all versions of HL7v2
*   [OHDSI OMOP Common Data Model](https://www.ohdsi.org/data-standardization/) - Standardized data model for many healthcare concepts, awesome Github presence including scripts for many major relational databases.

### Contents / Laboratory

*   [OpenELIS](https://openelis-global.org) - Laboratory Information System for Global Health.

### Contents / Applications

*   [Simple](https://github.com/simpledotorg/) - For clinicians to track patients with high blood pressure.

### Contents / Books

*   [Inspired EHRs (‚≠ê128)](https://github.com/goinvo/EHR) - Ideas, designs, and techniques for designing an Electronic Health Record (EHR).

### Contents / Data

*   [EDS\_NLP (‚≠ê125)](https://github.com/aphp/edsnlp) - provides a set of spaCy components to extract information from clinical notes written in French
*   [eds-scikit (‚≠ê40)](https://github.com/aphp/eds-scikit) - a tool to assist data scientists working on the AP-HP's Clinical Data Warehouse. It is specifically targeted for OMOP-standardized data.

### Contents / Design

*   [Determinants of Health (‚≠ê86)](https://github.com/goinvo/HealthDeterminants) - Determinants of Health Visualization.
*   [Health Icons (‚≠ê719)](https://github.com/resolvetosavelives/healthicons) - A collection of open source icons for public health projects.

### Contents / Machine learning

*   [MedicalGPT (‚≠ê4k)](https://github.com/shibing624/MedicalGPT/blob/main/README_EN.md) - Training Your Own Medical GPT Model with ChatGPT Training Pipeline.
items.content_html:
Contents / EHR

  • ERPNext (‚≠ê26k) - Modules that help manage patients, appointments, consultations, lab tests, and billing.
  • HOSxP - Thai Hospital Information System that aims to ease the healthcare workflow of health centers and central hospitals.

Contents / Specifications

  • Continuity of Care Document - Continuity of Care Document specifications
  • DICOM Standards Browser - Provides an effective way to learn the DICOM standard and inspect DICOM attributes.
  • HL7 Version 2 - Specifications for all versions of HL7v2
  • OHDSI OMOP Common Data Model - Standardized data model for many healthcare concepts, awesome Github presence including scripts for many major relational databases.

Contents / Laboratory

  • OpenELIS - Laboratory Information System for Global Health.

Contents / Applications

  • Simple - For clinicians to track patients with high blood pressure.

Contents / Books

  • Inspired EHRs (‚≠ê128) - Ideas, designs, and techniques for designing an Electronic Health Record (EHR).

Contents / Data

  • EDS_NLP (‚≠ê125) - provides a set of spaCy components to extract information from clinical notes written in French
  • eds-scikit (‚≠ê40) - a tool to assist data scientists working on the AP-HP's Clinical Data Warehouse. It is specifically targeted for OMOP-standardized data.

Contents / Design

  • Determinants of Health (‚≠ê86) - Determinants of Health Visualization.
  • Health Icons (‚≠ê719) - A collection of open source icons for public health projects.

Contents / Machine learning

  • MedicalGPT (‚≠ê4k) - Training Your Own Medical GPT Model with ChatGPT Training Pipeline.

items.title: Awesome Ios
items.content_text:
### Analytics

*   [Emerge Tools](https://www.emergetools.com) - Prevent app size & performance regressions on every pull request, get automated insights on how to improve.

### Optimization

*   [SmallStrings (‚≠ê165)](https://github.com/EmergeTools/SmallStrings) - Reduce localized .strings file sizes by 80%.

### Other Testing

*   [ETTrace (‚≠ê619)](https://github.com/EmergeTools/ETTrace) - Locally measure performance of your app, without Xcode or Instruments.
items.content_html:
Analytics

  • Emerge Tools - Prevent app size & performance regressions on every pull request, get automated insights on how to improve.

Optimization

  • SmallStrings (‚≠ê165) - Reduce localized .strings file sizes by 80%.

Other Testing

  • ETTrace (‚≠ê619) - Locally measure performance of your app, without Xcode or Instruments.

### LLMOps / Multi-agents

items.title: Awesome Naming
items.content_text:
### Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence

*   [Gradient descent](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gradient_descent) - Minimizing a cost function by iteratively computing the gradient and moving in the direction of steepest descent.
*   [Hallucination](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hallucination_\(artificial_intelligence\)) - A confident response by an AI that does not seem to be justified by its training data.
items.content_html:
Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence

  • Gradient descent - Minimizing a cost function by iteratively computing the gradient and moving in the direction of steepest descent.
  • Hallucination - A confident response by an AI that does not seem to be justified by its training data.

items.title: Awesome Micropython
items.content_text:
### Sensors / Accelerometer Digital

*   [msa301-micropython-driver (‚≠ê3)](https://github.com/wojciech-szmyt/msa301-micropython-driver) - Homebrew MicroPython driver for MSA301 3-axis accelerometer. Tested on Raspberry Pico.

### Shells / On Host

*   [mpr (‚≠ê21)](https://github.com/bulletmark/mpr) - Wrapper for MicroPython mpremote tool.
items.content_html:
Sensors / Accelerometer Digital

  • msa301-micropython-driver (‚≠ê3) - Homebrew MicroPython driver for MSA301 3-axis accelerometer. Tested on Raspberry Pico.

Shells / On Host

  • mpr (‚≠ê21) - Wrapper for MicroPython mpremote tool.

items.title: Awesome Neovim
items.content_text:
### AI / Diagnostics

*   [Robitx/gp.nvim (‚≠ê1.2k)](https://github.com/Robitx/gp.nvim) - ChatGPT like sessions and instructable text/code operations in your favorite editor.
*   [jackMort/ChatGPT.nvim (‚≠ê4k)](https://github.com/jackMort/ChatGPT.nvim) - Effortless Natural Language Generation with OpenAI's ChatGPT API.

items.title: Awesome Playwright
items.content_text:
### Utils

*   [playwright-ui5 (‚≠ê9)](https://github.com/detachhead/playwright-ui5) - Custom selector engine for sapui5.
*   [playwright-xpath (‚≠ê8)](https://github.com/detachhead/playwright-xpath) - Custom selector engine for xpath 2 and 3.
items.content_html:
Utils

  • playwright-ui5 (‚≠ê9) - Custom selector engine for sapui5.
  • playwright-xpath (‚≠ê8) - Custom selector engine for xpath 2 and 3.

items.title: Awesome Go
items.content_text:
### Networking

*   [gnet (‚≠ê22)](https://github.com/fish-tennis/gnet) - `gnet` is a high-performance networking framework,especially for game servers.

### Tutorials / Libraries for creating HTTP middlewares

*   [Hex Monscape (‚≠ê79)](https://github.com/Haraj-backend/hex-monscape) - Getting started guidelines in writing maintainable code using Hexagonal Architecture.
items.content_html:
Networking

  • gnet (‚≠ê22) - gnet is a high-performance networking framework,especially for game servers.

Tutorials / Libraries for creating HTTP middlewares

  • Hex Monscape (‚≠ê79) - Getting started guidelines in writing maintainable code using Hexagonal Architecture.

items.title: Awesome Polars
items.content_text:
### Tutorials & workshops / Miscellaneous

*   [Data Pipelines with Polars: Step-by-Step Guide](https://towardsdatascience.com/data-pipelines-with-polars-step-by-step-guide-f5474accacc4) - A tutorial that explains how to build data pipelines with Polars by [@AntonsRuberts](https://github.com/AntonsRuberts). Code used is available on Github [here (‚≠ê64)](https://github.com/aruberts/tutorials/tree/main/polars).
items.content_html:
Tutorials & workshops / Miscellaneous

  • Data Pipelines with Polars: Step-by-Step Guide - A tutorial that explains how to build data pipelines with Polars by @AntonsRuberts. Code used is available on Github here (‚≠ê64).
